item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0465; 09:28AM; 636 N Lucerne Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bZOvRF" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bZOvRF</a>; #Larchmont; 37 LAFD Firefighters took just 27 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire in a 1,268 square foot one-story home. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E29 E447 E52 E61 RA82 RA827 SO1 T27 T29; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0465; 09:01AM; 636 N Lucerne Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4bZOvRF" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4bZOvRF</a>; #Larchmont; #PRELIM: Fire to the rear of a one-story residence threatening adjacent homes.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 E227 E229 E447 E52 E61 RA82 RA827 T27 T29; CH9; 12; Brian Humphrey

Train vs. Pedestrian Fatality; INC#0906; 01:47PM; 4421 S Long Beach Av; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3mOKcP9" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3mOKcP9</a>; #CentralAlameda; PRELIM: One pedestrian (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) deceased at scene after being struck by and removed by firefighters from beneath a Metro A (Blue) Line light rail train that remains at the location. No injuries reported among the 42 total persons aboard the train. Media Inquiries: Metro, LAPD Central Traffic Division (Incident #2614) and Medical Examiner.; FS 21; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E14 E15 E221 E46 EM1 HR3 RA14 T21; CH7; 14; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 05/30/2024 INC#1301

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1301; 06:10PM; 1400 N Soto St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4e42Gac" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4e42Gac</a>; #BoyleHeights; *Address Corrected* 98 LAFD Firefighters took 87 minutes in largely defensive firefighting operations, to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire deep within and atop a vacant three-story apartment building in the final stages of construction. LAFD crews prevented fire spread to two nearby occupied structures. No injury. Fire cause under active investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E211 E25 E27 E3 E47 EA2 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA2 RA27 RA47 RA801 RA803 SO1 SQ21 T1 T11 T2 T3 T9 UR27 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1301; 04:43PM; 1376 N Soto St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/454EArA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/454EArA</a>; #BoyleHeights; *Address Tentative*. PRELIM: Defensive firefighting operations at a three-story apartment building under construction well involved with fire, exposing a single family home to the rear. ; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E211 E25 E27 E47 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA2 RA27 RA801 SQ21 T1 T11 T2 T3 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#1671; 10:25PM; 8764 S HOBART BL; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/HRhbQufVucpJMcfP9" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/HRhbQufVucpJMcfP9</a>; #GramercyPark; Companies arrived to find a vacant one-story single family dwelling well-involved with fire. Following extended forcible entry challenges, 36 firefighters focused on protecting neighboring homes and extinguishing the fire using coordinated interior and roof operations. Total working time to knockdown was 19 minutes, though crews remain on-scene for overhaul. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; E(3) T(2) RA(2) RA-800(1) E57 RA857 RA257 E266 T66 E33 E64 T64 E264 BC13 BC11 RA57 EM13 ; CH7; 12; Lyndsey Lantz

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0854; 03:13PM; 5517 W San Vicente Blvd; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA</a>; #MidWilshire; 78 firefighters battled fire in this vacant strip mall for 1 hour and 49 minutes. Crews initially forced entry to the structure and mounted an interior attack with handlines, in coordination with companies on the roof who ventilated the structure. Once "defensive mode" was declared, all personnel retreated from the structure and fought fire with heavy streams of water from a distance. One front facade and the roof collapsed, with no injuries reported. Though a second facade appeared compromised, a complete knockdown of the fire was declared with no further structural collapse. All nearby exposures were protected with no fire spread. Several support companies were attached to the incident to provide rehabilitation and air tanks to firefighters on-scene. LAFD's heavy equipment specialists and several fire companies remain on-scene for a planned demolition of the vacant building due to safety concerns. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; E(6) T(6) RA(2) RA-800(2) E68 E261 T61 RA861 RA61 E58 E229 T29 E294 T94 BC18 BC11 SO1 E215 T15 E13 CM22 EM5 BC13 CM20 E61 RA58 T27 E227 UR27 E95 SQ95 EM11 T3 E203 E3 UR3 HR3 UR88 BC1 RA803 PI1 PI2 HE1 RS3 EA1 AR1 AR7 AR39 ; CH9; 15; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire; INC#0854; 01:24PM; 5517 W San Vicente Blvd; MAP: <a href="https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://maps.app.goo.gl/upEamVv3Cc2vLLqXA</a>; #MidWilshire; Initial arriving companies found a one-story vacant and boarded-up strip mall, approximately 50ft x 75ft, with light smoke showing from the attic. Crews initiated forcible entry and roof operations, but the fire load and extended operation time ultimately forced personnel to adopt a "defensive" posture -- all companies retreated and heavy streams of water were employed to continue extinguishing the flames and protect all exposures. One facade collapsed due to fire load during use of heavy water streams; no injuries reported. Crews remain active on-scene at this time.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; E(6) T(6) RA(2) RA-800(2) E68 E261 T61 RA861 RA61 E58 E229 T29 E294 T94 BC18 BC11 SO1 E215 T15 E13 CM22 EM5 BC13 CM20 E61 RA58 T27 E227 UR27 E95 SQ95 EM11 T3 E203 E3 UR3 HR3 UR88 BC1 RA803 PI1 PI2 HE1 RS3 EA1 AR1 AR7 AR39 ; CH9; 15; Lyndsey Lantz

Hiker Rescue; INC#0696; 11:50AM; 4730 Crystal Springs Dr; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3yNc3e0" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3yNc3e0</a>; #GriffithPark; Park rangers on-scene in a remote area of Griffith Park reported an injured male hiker, approximately 23 years old, with an ankle injury. LAFD's helicopter crew lowered a paramedic down to the patient, while ground crews made access to the remote location with vehicles capable of navigating Griffith Park's narrow trails. Due to steep and difficult terrain, LAFD personnel ultimately decided to hoist the patient into a helicopter and transport him to a nearby hospital for further treatment.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E235 E56 H4 H5 HA4 HA5 RA35 RA56 RA835 RH114 T35; CH7; 14; Lyndsey Lantz

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0408; 09:13AM; 6400 S Crenshaw Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/450K070" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/450K070</a>; #HydePark; 37 firefighters spent 17 minutes in the offensive mode, fully extinguishing a well-involved fire. No injuries were reported, and no occupants were located in the home during searches. Companies remain on-scene for overhaul and salvage of property; traffic will be temporarily affected in the immediate area.; FS 66; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; BC13 BC18 E294 E57 E66 E94 RA266 RA66 RA866 SO1 SQ21 T66 T94; CH9; 13; Lyndsey Lantz
